Class VendingMachine

  • java.lang.Object
    • VendingMachine
  • public class VendingMachine
extends java.lang.Object
    A vending machine.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      VendingMachine()
      Constructs a VendingMachine object and reads in data from the text files to the datafield ArrayLists

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String addCoin​(Coin aCoin)
      This method takes a Coin as an input and adds it to the currentCoins arraylist, it then returns the current value of coins in the machine as a String
      void addProduct​(Product aProduct, int quantity)
      This method inserts a product into the products ArrayList, and adds its quantity to the productsQuantity arraylist providing the Product doesn't already exist.
      void buyProduct​(Product p)
      This method is used to buy a product.
      double currentCoinsValue()
      This method returns the current value of coins in the currentCoins arraylist
      int getCoinQuantity​(Coin c)
      This coin returns the quantity of a Coin
      Product[] getProductTypes()
      This method returns the ArrayList of products as an array of products
      int indexOf​(java.lang.Object o)
      This method takes an object, checks whether its an instanceof Coin or Product, and then finds its index in coins or products respectively by comparing its datafields with the other objects in the arraylist
      double removeMoney()
      This method removes all the money in the currentCoins arraylist, and returns the value of that money as a double
      int removeMoneyOp​(Coin c)
      This method 'removes' a pre-selected coin from the coins arraylist by setting it's parallel quantity in the coinQuantities arraylist to zero

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • VendingMachine

        public VendingMachine()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a VendingMachine object and reads in data from the text files to the datafield ArrayLists
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - e

    • Method Detail

      • addProduct

        public void addProduct​(Product aProduct,
                       int quantity)
                throws java.io.IOException
        This method inserts a product into the products ArrayList, and adds its quantity to the productsQuantity arraylist providing the Product doesn't already exist. If it does, only the quantity is updated. Then the products.txt and productsQuantity.txt files are updated.
        Parameters:
        Product - aProduct int quantity
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - e

      • getProductTypes

        public Product[] getProductTypes()
        This method returns the ArrayList of products as an array of products
        Returns:
        Product[]

      • addCoin

        public java.lang.String addCoin​(Coin aCoin)
        This method takes a Coin as an input and adds it to the currentCoins arraylist, it then returns the current value of coins in the machine as a String
        Parameters:
        Coin - aCoin
        Returns:
        String currentCoinsValue

      • removeMoney

        public double removeMoney()
        This method removes all the money in the currentCoins arraylist, and returns the value of that money as a double
        Returns:
        double

      • buyProduct

        public void buyProduct​(Product p)
                throws java.io.IOException
        This method is used to buy a product. It checks if the product is in stock, and then checks if the user has inserted enough money into the machine. If not, it throws a VendingException. Otherwise it buys the product by removing coins from the currentCoins arraylist and inserting them into coinQuantities. Then, the coinQuantities and productQuantities text files are updated.
        Parameters:
        Product - p: Product the user is buying
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - e

      • removeMoneyOp

        public int removeMoneyOp​(Coin c)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        This method 'removes' a pre-selected coin from the coins arraylist by setting it's parallel quantity in the coinQuantities arraylist to zero
        Parameters:
        Coin - c : The type of coin the operator wants to remove from the machine
        Returns:
        int : the amount of money removed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - e

      • currentCoinsValue

        public double currentCoinsValue()
        This method returns the current value of coins in the currentCoins arraylist
        Returns:
        double : current value of coins in the currentCoins arraylist

      • getCoinQuantity

        public int getCoinQuantity​(Coin c)
        This coin returns the quantity of a Coin
        Parameters:
        Coin - c : the coin you want to get the quantity of
        Returns:
        int : the quantity of the coin

      • indexOf

        public int indexOf​(java.lang.Object o)
        This method takes an object, checks whether its an instanceof Coin or Product, and then finds its index in coins or products respectively by comparing its datafields with the other objects in the arraylist
        Parameters:
        Object - o : the object you want to get the indexOf
        Returns:
        int : index of the Object in its respective arraylist
